project_title: 2D дрейф космических лучей в градиенте магнитного поля
control_field_lines_help: Leg edits wait for Apply while field lines are visible.
control_field_lines_help_on: Leg edits wait for Apply while field lines are visible.
control_field_lines_help_off: Leg edits apply instantly when field lines are hidden.

sections.heading: Main actions
items: - Press "Demonstration" to open the interactive scene and tweak parameters in real time.
- "Theory" and "Authors" show reference sections, while "Exit" closes the program.
- The RU/EN pill in the header switches the interface language.

sections.heading: Control panel sliders
items: - "Number of molecules" sets particle count; hit "Apply" to rebuild the system with the new total.
- "Simulation speed" accelerates or slows the integrator without breaking stability.
- "Particle size" scales both the collision radius and visuals consistently.
- "Tagged particles" changes how many highlighted dots appear after "Add particles."
- "Magnetic gradient" stretches the in-plane B-field so you can align stronger/weaker regions with the compass.
- "B₀" tweaks how sharply each footpoint's magnetic pulse falls off, sharpening or softening its effect.

sections.heading: Demonstration helpers
items: - "Add particles" injects fresh tagged particles to explore specific trajectories.
- "Apply" commits the slider values (except wall temperatures) and restarts the run.
- "Dim background/Restore colors" fades non-tagged particles, while "Show trail/Hide trail" draws the path of the tracked one.
- "Track" picks a random particle, dims the rest, and draws magnetic and solar-wind vectors to show how each force pushes it.
- "Reset" clears counters; the right-hand panel keeps showing instant and cumulative flux.

sections.heading: Field overview and species
items: - The right panel shows compass targets for the B-field and solar wind; clicking one rotates the arrow and its effect on particles.
- The legend explains each species, and the editable table lets you tweak charge, diffusion, drift, and lifetime on the fly.
